It reminds you of when America was a British colony, and it enables you to perpetuate the myth that you're plucky little underdogs with right on your side. That's far more palatable than thinking of America as an overbearing, imperial power, throwing its weight around on the world stage. Do the world's worst humans make the world's best judges? Simon Cowell is now reportedly doing all he can to convince his American business partners that the 27-year-old Cheryl Cole has what it takes to draw audiences in across the Atlantic. The source added to The Sun newspaper, Simon Cowell has been the only one pushing for her and trying to convince everyone that she'll be a big hit. They want to see if the American public warm to her before she takes on such a high-profile role in one of the biggest shows on U.S. TV. There have been lots of heated conversations and debates about it.

David Cameron has repeatedly defended Andy Coulson , one of his inner circle, and on Friday defended his own judgment in hiring him after his resignation from the News of the World.

interview, Simon Cowell talked about The X Factor launch in America. With auditions set to begin on March 27th in Los Angeles, people can register online now by going to Fox.com/ thexfactor. We actually do the auditions in arenas where you have to perform in front of 4,000-5,000 people. It's a long day. You'll begin to understand why I become very grumpy, Simon Cowell told Nancy O'Dell during the ET interview that aired tonight on ABC. The X Factor auditions are open to vocal groups and solo singers, over the age of 12- and there's no upper age limit.
